title: Large-Scale Strategy for Maintaining Narrative Consistency Using Principled Improv Teaching in K-12 Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of pedagogy and science curriculum design
context.additional_context: Implementing narrative structures in K-12 science classes within simulation/VR environments and acquiring improvisational adjustment strategies

learning_goals: Learners can design three or more principled improvisation strategies for reconstructing narrative lines based on students' inquiry activities in VR simulation environments
Learners can explain methods for maintaining narrative coherence using collective knowledge objects (consensus models, inquiry question boards, experimental graphs, etc.)
Learners can apply and evaluate improvisational teaching strategies considering conceptual, cognitive, and interactive aspects to VR simulations
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
